image.altText: Adnyamathanha elder Uncle Charles Jackson.

props.synopsis: It has been almost one month since Port Augusta became a Declared Public Precinct, but Uncle Charles Jackson OAM says the move simply shifts the issues "out of sight".

title.children: 'It's directed at First Nations people': Elder shares concerns about Declared Public Precinct in Port Augusta

image.altText: An underwater photo of a giant kelp forest.

props.synopsis: A global report into kelp forests has found they are under threat from climate change and conservationists are concerned the vital underwater ecosystems on Australia's coastline are not getting the attention they need.

title.children: Loss of vital underwater forests happening 'out of sight, out of mind', marine experts say

image.altText: Fisherman leaning up against a boat

props.synopsis: Some South Australian fishers are worried recreational catches are skewing the data on fish stocks, as amateurs aren't subject to the same regulations.

title.children: Professional fishers call for amateurs to get a licence to cast a line

image.altText: Broc Feeney and Will Brown in the pit lane, holding their trophies for the cameras.

props.synopsis: The final round of the Supercars season pits teammates against each other in a title showdown.

title.children: Where Will Brown and Broc Feeney need to finish in the Adelaide 500 to become Supercars champion

image.altText: A young man and a young woman superimposed on a cartoon background.

props.synopsis: While "master manipulators" are trawling social media to trick many young people into making bad decisions, Australia's peak consumer agency has some advice for those who have fallen victim.

title.children: The 'hot state' tricks scammers use on teens through social media

image.altText: Two small trucks with Coles written on them and images of strawberries in a concrete delivery bay

props.synopsis: A South Australian council is upset because it says Woolworths and Coles are making grocery deliveries to a town where larger stores are not allowed to open on Sundays.

title.children: Concern major supermarkets flouting Sunday trading ban in SA town

image.altText: A middle-aged man stands beside a creek which has hazard signs on it

props.synopsis: Remnants of the Millennium drought regulator have been discovered in the only water inlet and outlet of Lake Bonney in SA's Riverland, frustrating locals who say the slab was dangerous to water users.

title.children: Huge concrete slab found in SA lake despite government claims it was removed a decade earlier

image.altText: Koala sitting on a bed inside a house.

props.synopsis: Something soft and cuddly on a bed can be a welcome sight if that something is inanimate, like a pillow — but in the early hours of Wednesday morning an Adelaide couple were forced to contend with a friendly, if unexpected, intruder.

title.children: 'We believe he came through the dog door': Koala sitting on bed startles couple on return from work

image.altText: A man carrying a kangaroo that has burned and bandaged paws.

props.synopsis: Areas that had multiple fires prior to 2019–20 had greater biodiversity losses when Black Summer fires hit compared to areas that had burnt once or not all beforehand.

title.children: Prescribed burns are used to reduce bushfire risk. A new study suggests it has the opposite effect

image.altText: A man with a beard and grey hair on an old boat

props.synopsis: South Australia's state coroner will investigate the circumstances surrounding the death of Anthony Higgins, who went missing off the coast of Granite Island in September 2020.

title.children: Death of boatman Anthony Higgins, who went missing twice in one month, to be investigated

image.altText: A sign saying CORONERS COURT on a modern sandstone building

props.synopsis: An inquest into the drowning of serviceman Gary Dale Sargeant will investigate the way his mental health was handled by the RAAF, which initially refused to provide police with an image of him after he went missing.

title.children: RAAF serviceman's death following mental health episode investigated by coronial inquest

image.altText: A brown and yellow fly.

props.synopsis: Growers in South Australia's pest-free area are under enormous financial and mental stress as they battle Queensland fruit-fly outbreaks.

title.children: South Australian fruit growers fight to save their pest-free advantage

image.altText: Several firefighters inside a house destroyed by fire and its roof collapsed

props.synopsis: Police say while the cause of the fire is yet to be determined, it is not suspicious.

title.children: Woman found dead after house fire in Adelaide's south

image.altText: Donald Trump and Joe Biden sit in the Oval Office and shake hands.

props.synopsis: Joe Biden welcomes his long-time nemesis, Donald Trump, back to the White House for an undoubtedly uncomfortable Oval Office meeting to discuss the transition of power.

title.children: 'It's a nice world today': Trump meets Biden at White House before appointing more loyalists to key roles

image.altText: A girl in a red jumper and black tracksuit pants sits on a couch indoors at night looking at her mobile phone.

props.synopsis: Social media companies would be required to take preventative action against the worst foreseeable harms of their platforms under new laws the federal government has proposed.

title.children: Online platforms would be legally responsible for keeping Australians safe under new 'duty of care' laws

image.altText: A plume of smoke rising out of a residential district full of apartment blocks in Beirut.

props.synopsis: Hezbollah strongholds in Beirut have endured another day of Israeli bombardment, as Lebanon waited to hear details of a proposed ceasefire from the US.

title.children: Six Israeli soldiers killed in Lebanon as Beirut hit by second day of air strikes

image.altText: A woman holds her head in her hands

props.synopsis: More than half of migrant women have been sexually harassed at work with their customers, co-workers and bosses among the biggest perpetrators, a new union survey has found.

title.children: 'Sexual objects who can be exploited': Harassment of migrant women rife in Australian workplaces, report finds

image.altText: Two hands hold a piggy bank full of coins.

props.synopsis: Superannuation funds have faced a Senate committee after a lawsuit was launched against Cbus. Australia's unemployment rate has held steady at 4.1pc in October.  Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: 'Far from perfect': Cbus execs apologise before senate inquiry, Bitcoin sets new record

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: AFP has broken into a crypto wallet to seize $9 million

image.altText: A composite picture of a woman in black-and-white and a man in colour, both looking serious.

props.synopsis: Championing higher wages is in Labor's DNA, but wage growth may not be able to overcome inflation anger if a rate cut doesn't arrive soon.

title.children: Wages are growing faster than inflation, but will it feel that way to voters?

image.altText: Vladimir Putin and Kim Jong Un walking through a rose garden together.

props.synopsis: Vladimir Putin and Kim Jong Un announced a mutual defence agreement earlier this year, which has paved the way for an estimated 10,000 North Korean troops to join in Russia's fight against Ukraine.

title.children: US vows 'firm response' to North Korean deployment on Ukraine front line

image.altText: A silhouetted crowd standing in the morning mist, holding up large flags.

props.synopsis: Activists are protesting proposed changes to New Zealand's foundational document, the Treaty of Waitangi. But is the bill more bark than bite?

title.children: What a controversial law change in New Zealand could mean for Māori people

image.altText: The side of a police car with the logo and word Police.

props.synopsis: The man and woman, both in their 60s, were found dead in a hot, dry creek bed only 2.5 kilometres from their vehicle.

title.children: 'They’d used all their water': Bodies of man and woman found in outback Queensland

image.altText: A house with Shawline Publishing's logo out the front, there is also a For Lease sign.

props.synopsis: Authors who had their books published through a company that has gone into liquidation say they are thousands of dollars out of pocket.

title.children: Hundreds of Australian authors out of pocket after Victorian publisher's collapse

image.altText: Angy pro choice and pro life protesters hold up placcards.

props.synopsis: The leader of the free world could make abortion access less free far away from home.

title.children: How the return of Trump could limit abortion — in Asia

image.altText: Manuel Del Brocco

props.synopsis: A former youth justice officer recovering from a debilitating workplace injury is warning about the safety risks posed by understaffed and overcrowded Northern Territory prisons.

title.children: Manuel had two fingers cut off in a cell door. He's worried about understaffing in NT prisons

image.altText: Whale in waters of Queensland's Moreton Bay Marine Park.

props.synopsis: New research has found that recreational boats may be underestimated as a strike risk to migrating whales in Moreton Bay — a region with an "unusual proportion" of humpback whale calves.

title.children: Collision risk for whales migrating through Queensland waters has been underestimated, research finds

image.altText: Socceroos coach Tony Popovic stands with his arms folded at training.

props.synopsis: Australia hosts Saudia Arabia in Melbourne with a chance to move into outright second of their group.

title.children: Socceroos ready for any Saudi approach in pivotal World Cup qualifier

image.altText: An older man smiles while holding an Academy Award as he stands next to another man.

props.synopsis: 'Merchant Ivory' is often used as shorthand for lavish period films. A new doco tracks the remarkable life of the two men behind the production company, and the love that kept them going.

title.children: After launching the careers of Emma Thompson and Hugh Grant, this 96yo director is telling his own story

image.altText: Lisa McCune, a blonde woman in a black top, smiles slightly. She's standing in front of a window looking out on Sydney Harbour.

props.synopsis: Lisa McCune stars in the Australian premiere of Lynn Nottage's Pulitzer Prize-winning Sweat, a play that uncovers the simmering tensions beneath America in 2024.

title.children: As the world digests Trump's re-election, Lisa McCune stars in 'the play that explains his win'

image.altText: Black and white still of Margaret Sutherland at the piano, marking up a part.

props.synopsis: Margaret Sutherland made a significant contribution to Australia's music and arts scene, despite the challenges of being a woman and composer through the mid-20th century.

title.children: In the 1930s, Margaret Sutherland's husband didn't want her to compose, but her music is still being played today

image.altText: A protest where someone is holding a sign saying "stop Nazis".

props.synopsis: With a federal election looming, far-right party Alternative for Germany is running second in the polls. Here's how it got there.

title.children: 'Close the borders': Behind the rise of the far right in Germany

image.altText: Two suited men exchange a handshake

props.synopsis: Robert F Kennedy Junior is tipped to play a big role in the new Trump administration and has gone on record saying he wants to move away from seed oils and pesticide-intensive agriculture.

title.children: Will Robert F Kennedy Jr 'go wild' on US agriculture and what could it mean for Australia?

image.altText: A young man and a young woman superimposed on a cartoon background.

props.synopsis: While "master manipulators" are trawling social media to trick many young people into making bad decisions, Australia's peak consumer agency has some advice for those who have fallen victim.

title.children: The 'hot state' tricks scammers use on teens through social media
